title: IT Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH)
Interview Descriptions: -screening interview via phone for about 30 minutes -main interview with a presentation and team 2-3 hours -then one ups with senior managers -offer call and negotiations - close contract
Interview Questions: tell us about your self?

title: Part-time Student Employee Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: There was a single interview following application submission. The questions were basic: What is a flaw, what can you teach others, why are you interested. They got back within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: What is a flaw you have? Why are you interested in this position? What type of mentorship do you prefer?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: Online interview and last 30 min. There are two interviewers. The process is pretty smooth, and the interviewers are pretty friendly. And they offered the information about the next step which is great.
Interview Questions: What brought you to be interested in this position

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: Ask about the classes you have taken and howd youd approach tutoring a peer in the area you are studying or have knowledge about. Interview was easy. Make sure you have at least a B+ in the class.
Interview Questions: - How do you take learning skills and transfer them into teaching?

title: Culinary Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: Very light and not stressful. Had no issues with getting hired. They don’t tell you how how strict their call off policies are, but for the most part was a nice place to work and had very nice employees and managers.
Interview Questions: What  are you looking to get out of this job?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview prescreen for behavioral portion, technical remote interview including timed examination, in-person behavioral and technical interview with whiteboard problems and practical development applications. Difficult interview process to truly test your ability as an engineer.
Interview Questions: Describe the differences between an abstract class and an interface

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was easy to get into a science based-lab; just know what you want to pursue and professors at OU are glad to help you reach your goals. High resource availability and a supportive culture all around.
Interview Questions: What are you goals in the next year?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: After an initial phone interview with the entire committee, I was invited to campus where I gave a teaching demonstration, met with the committee, and the Dean. I heard back about a week after the on-campus interview
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy?

title: Store Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very informal. 3 managers took me back to a storage/supply room and we stood and talked for about 20 minutes. They each asked various questions, but they mostly revolved around how I knew other employees who worked there.
Interview Questions:
How do you know the employees?
What are your relationships like with them?
What is your expected graduation date?
What is your major?
What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Ie Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with the focus on describing my thesis work. Then I went through my proposed solution and gave them a detailed about the programming language that I used. me about other experiences on academic projects as well.
Interview Questions: Describe how you solve the median problem?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: There is not much beating around the bush when it comes to most student worker positions. They will explain what your position will be doing and they will schedule a day for you to come in and see what it is you will be doing.
Interview Questions: Will you be fine with working the desk or the call center?

title: Residential Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: I really enjoyed the two-step process where I got to speak to many people involved with resident life. I really enjoyed the questions and the time I was allotted to speak.
Interview Questions: What does diversity and inclusion mean to me.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview, and seven people were on the phone .each one asked a question and three minutes for each question. It was quick, and I felt rushed all the time.
Interview Questions: How can you improve diversity and inclusion?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and relaxed. Almost didn't feel like an interview to me.  There were two individuals during the process. Both took turns asking questions. The job is basic so I did not expect it to be a hard process.
Interview Questions: What past work history do you have?

title: Campus Recreation Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: super relaxed, no serious questions. the interview was just more behavioral. the people who interviewed me were also very nice, friendly, and easy to talk to. I got the job (student job) and kept it the entire time I went to school at OU.
Interview Questions: what is a major challenge you have faced?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: 1st round with 2 members of the search committee, follow up 2nd round all-day with the search committee and key faculty and dean, which included a research job talk. Also included group interviews with students.
Interview Questions:
Q: Describe your start-up equipment and space needs.
Q: What is your teaching background?

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: I  love the university.  The  Ohio University help was a great job to have.  The people were amazing to be around.  I worked there for 4 years.  I would do it all over again
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: It was through an application through the university. Worked with a team to come up with an innovative product in the cosmetic industry. Had mentor meetings every week with Sogeti to discuss ideas and questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be apart of OICP?

title: Coordinator of Campus Communications and External Relations (Social Media) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ohio University in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial interview with about 6 people from the RHE which lasted about 15mins. 2 weeks later, I had an email requesting a social media inbox activity which was followed by 3 interviews. One interview by the previous team, another with about 10 people from the various regional offices. (It appears questions were compiled and the Dean did most of the questioning) the final one was more conversational and was held with the direct supervisor of the position. This was in the COVID period and these interviews were online.
Interview Questions:
What makes you a great fit for the role?
What's your take n social media marketing?
For a this position, most of the work will be to reach out to our audience who are in predominantly rural areas. How would you communicate to them?

title: Instructor, College Or University Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: They asked me questions about my teaching experience  about college level math. Then asked some questions about how to deal with student diversity and what courses do i want to teach.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your teaching experience.

title: Tour Guide Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ohio University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Super fun interview process was not intimidating at all just got to let your personality shine through!

I recommend making sure you are making good contact and do what ever you can to make the interviewers (current tour guides) know you want to be there.
Interview Questions: Tell us your Ohio story..

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ohio University in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online (found link through Aquatic Center website) where I submitted my Red Cross certificate along with my resume and cover letter. I was contacted for a phone interview where I answered 5-8 questions and then was invited to an in-water skills test at the facility.
Interview Questions: How many breaths do you use when preforming CPR?

title: MBA Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: A general application process was followed by two rounds of interviews. The first one was a group interview but the second one was individual. The group interview was very intense and took all day to complete. Many faculty and current students conducted the interview.
Interview Questions: If you could do one thing over again, what would it be?

title: Assistant Resident Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
- Online application component was the first step
- Resume, references, and questionnaire included in the online component
- Presentation and interview combined to be about 45 minutes long with a panel of 2-3 interviewers
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths and weaknesses and how do you see each of these playing into your role here?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: While the job was not as they described the interview process was organized, put together well, and had good interviewers. Would recommend the interview process. lol lol lol lol lolo lollol   looll
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: Found the job through an email delivered to all the media students in the Scripps College of Communications that would have experience needed to do the job. I applied online for the position and two weeks later they let me know I had made it through the first phase of narrowing down the number of applicants from 74 to 14. I was then scheduled to meet with all the heads of each department: 360 video, audio and game development. After the interview they told me I would be notified the next whether or not I would receive the position. I received an email congratulating me on receiving the position and that I would be starting the job as soon as possible.
Interview Questions: What are you most excited about with rising AR/VR technologies?

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: Laid back group interview with two orientation leaders and the director.  They were looking for good answers as well as a personality that would work well with other orientation leaders.
Interview Questions: What was your favorite tier II course?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ohio University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Great, 1 phone interview, 2 face to face interview, and response time  within 1 week. Everyone at the campus and the office were amazing. Would like to been part of the team but other outside factors made my decision
Interview Questions: do you prefer research or teaching

title: 3D Artist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: They asked me about my opinion on Virtual Reality. They also talked to me in a casual way. It was relaxed and conversational. Their main goal was to see if I would be a good person to work with. It was clear that they believe in a fun work environment that is dedicated to helping students gain useful knowledge.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Virtual Reality development?

title: Technology Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed on the phone for about 45 minutes and it seemed to go well. A few days later I was scheduled for a 2 hour in-person interview. I met with 3 out of the 4 individuals that were expected to be in attendance. I was asked about my interest in the position, my experience, and briefly introduced to the database software around which the position revolves. Everyone was polite and friendly.
Interview Questions: What interested you in this position?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Ohio University (Columbus, OH) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview and application process took about two months to fully complete. The organization seemed well prepared and the HR staff I interacted with were fair and competent. I was interviewed by the hiring manager and also offered a detailed tour of the university campus.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you handled conflict?

title: PACE Photographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through Ohio University, and I had to follow up to get the interview. A few weeks later I followed up and they offered the position to me. The interviews were relaxed and were used to see how competent I would be for the day to day assignments.
Interview Questions: How much photography and design experience do I have?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: a group people were separated by two supervisors, and each one should answer about 6 or 7 questions, and lastly, we were asked to do a scene-simulate. The entire process was not that hard, and all the questions were about how to deal with students, and none of the questions were about your skills, and skills check are based on your reference and recommend letters.
Interview Questions: What if you meet a student that not prepared?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Asked for resume, portfolio and talked about experience and what I could learn from the position. Met other office members and toured the office. Energetic and enthusiastic environment from boss and other members of the office.
Interview Questions: Flexibility with hour

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Ohio University (Ironton, OH) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very informal. I gave my resume to the manager. Once he looked over it, he spoke with me once as I was walking in the cafe to work on homework, then hired me on the spot. I spent a lot of time in the cafe to begin with, working on assignments between classes, and my good friend already worked in there as well. The interview was essentially "Hey, do you still want to work for us? Your friend said you were a hard worker in your classes."
Interview Questions: If I was dependable.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the graduate adviser in person. Separately, other professors went through my application, made decision and let me know. It was difficult getting a hold of the graduate adviser initially. Showed up after not hearing back from them for about a month.
Interview Questions: Just general questions about past research experience, previous coursework etc.

title: Assistant Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Ohio University (Pickerington, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very informal and brief.  The person that interviewed me seemed frazzled and rushed. There were a few questions about my availability and aspirations and the interview was over.  This may not be an accurate reflection of OU-L hiring process because I interviewed for an internship.
Interview Questions: Wanted to know about my availability

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Ohio University in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Subject matter specific questions.  Do your work and prepare for the interview in advance.  Look on the department’s website and see what initiatives they have been advancing.  Become familiar with those initiatives.
Interview Questions: What does diversity in the workplace add to the workplace?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I sent an email with intrigue in a social media position and they emailed me back to come in for an interview. Pays off to reach out for opportunities around campus as a student.
Interview Questions: What are your goals to improve the social media at Ohio University?

title: Nursing Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ohio University (Zanesville, OH) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty simple. At the time I was a student at the University in the nursing program. They needed additional help in the nursing lab and I was approached by the nursing lab director after she had seen me helping with another class's graduation ceremony.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations?

title: Child Care Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ohio University (South Point, OH) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very good.  I had two people in the room, one mainly asking questions, and one writing my answers. Asked me my experience with children.  I did not get to pick what age group I worked with, but very glad where I ended up.
Interview Questions: What would you do in certain situations with the children

title: Learning Community Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Simple behavioral questions. Nothing was that difficult at all Just be confident in what you believe is an answer that is truthful and encompasses all of your personality. The process was intimidating at all and it was almost enjoyable to go through.
Interview Questions: Name a time you failed?

title: Audit Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ohio University in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, answered several questions about experiences in certain situations and working environment. Followed by several emails working out details and final questions. Then in person interviews, with four of the office staff. Resume and personal questions. An email offering the job came two days after the interview.
Interview Questions: Pretty easy questions. nothing unexpected

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: Application, followed by interview. If you pass both of these preliminary cuts then you take a 10 week course that is essentially an extended interview. At the conclusion of the class you are rated on a 1-5 scale in 5 separate categories with the highest possible score being 25. This score largely determines if you are hired.
Interview Questions: There was no difficult question in the 10 week course/interview. It was largely a matter of knowing when to shut up. They would present you with a scenario that you may have to deal with as an RA (e.g. encountering a drunk student passed out in the hallway) and it was your job to resolve the situation as quickly and effectively as possible. Extended rants, offerings of personal antecedents, and your own personal opinion on the morality of the scenario are not helpful, they simply want to see the situation resolved as quickly as possible within the guidelines of university policy

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and they just called me one day and said that they had an opening. No interview required, very easy. You should apply months before you actually want the job because depending on the influx or exflux of people. People often quit
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Went smooth, straightforward questions, very nice. They asked me basic questions because the job isnt a hard one. It was just me and the manager and she made me feel comfortable. It was more casual than formal. overall it was a good experience and i was offered the job that day.
Interview Questions: If i cold multitask

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: Make friends with a professor and show that you are interested in working with them on a research project. Pretty easy process/
Interview Questions: Can you start now?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: A full day of interviews that were not all necessary.  They expect an hour long presentation which is also over-kill.  No one really seemed to care that I was there, and I had no opportunity to meet with the Dean of the college.
Interview Questions: They always ask the canned diversity question...be ready.

title: Consultor sénior de RR. HH. Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ohio University
Interview Descriptions: Group hire. The process is simple they interview you for the job first with a group interview than they test out skills. Make sure to get to know the person testing you on the skills because this really determines if you make it or break it
Interview Questions: Practice swimming

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Ohio University posts all jobs online. All faculty jobs are a nationwide search process followed by a telephone or skype interview. I was brought to an all-day on-campus interview which included public presentations, 1:1 interviews and group interviews.
Interview Questions: How do you compare your work to those practicing in the field?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ohio University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: you are assigned a professor. you meet weekly and get assigned research topics. then you do you research, consolidate it and turn it to your professor. you can use library resources and you sped less the the time needed to finish the weekly assignments.
Interview Questions: you do not have a choice of who you work with. It is part of the scholarship. You are assigned a professor and you meet you meet weekly and get assigned research topics. then you do you research, consolidate it and turn it to your professor.

title: Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was different than an interview. More of a training process. Was told what duties and assignments that I would be doing with the job. The supervisor was very nice and helpful. Was shown around the workplace.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Telerecruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Sat with the direct supervisor of the program after applying. She asked me why I wanted the job, why I felt I would be a good fit for undergraduate admissions and what other organizations I was a part of on campus. Explained basic duties of the job, hours and other job information. Gave me admissions pamphlets to look over and asked questions on university knowledge.
Interview Questions: Why does undergraduate admissions interest you?

title: Certified Personal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I'd highly recommend attending the ACE prep course, and be influential and outspoken while attending. Don't miss/skip a single one of those classes. The management tends to pick the leaders of that course as the new personal trainers. Be knowledgeable about fitness and look the part, to put it bluntly, there is nothing worse than a personal trainer that looks like they need a personal trainer. In the past, candidates had a phone and an in-person interview to get hired.
Interview Questions: - Demonstrate a  typical workout session with a mock client.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process from application to interview was somewhat lengthy with little communication but once the interview was held, the process sped up significantly.   Took almost 6 months from start to finish.
Interview Questions: Tell us your where you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Service Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with a manager, he asked me a few customer service questions and a few tech questions.He was curious about my background and having a tech related internship in the past certainly seemed to help my chances.
Interview Questions: Various questions regarding the use of MS Office and OU's website and systems.

title: Call Center Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with manager, discusses sales experience, explained how job worked, explained goals of the organization, contact w OU alumni to raise money, met w student managers to discuss qualifications
Interview Questions: What is your experience in sales?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Ohio University (Ironton, OH) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Filled out application on-line.  Got called in for an interview.  Got hired and had to fill out the typical paperwork.
Interview Questions: None

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Basic questions about imgaing a windows machine. 
What is Sysprep
What happens during sys prep
What are the details of silent install
What is GPO
How to mount printers through GPO
Interview Questions: What is Sysprep?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application, was already set up with the athletic department and was hired as soon as I submitted all of my document.s
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult as long as you meet specifications.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Search professors online, send emails to interested professors for jobs.
Interview Questions: No difficulty.

title: Marketing and Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ohio University (Norman, OK) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Panel of other employees took turns asking questions, boss listened and added additional questions and comments at the end of the interview
Interview Questions: When was a time when you were in charge of something and failed, and how did you overcome the failure?

title: Assistant Director Employer Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication included an online application.  Was offered a phone interview 2 days after the close of the application deadline.  Phone interview consisted of 5 individuals asking questions from the search committee.  About 1 week after the phone interview I was offered an on campus interview.  This was scheduled 3 weeks out.  During the interview I met one on one with the dean, department director, search committee, office staff, and presented a oral presentation.  I was taken to lunch by members of the search committee.  The office environment was very welcoming and friendly.
Interview Questions: What is my own personal definition of success.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: Basiclly I follow the application process poste on line and contact with the secretory regularly to check on the progress.
Interview Questions: Why OU?

title: MBA Student Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ohio University (Athens, OH) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: Very reasonable. Two 1:1 intervoews and thenn a group discussion on a topic.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?
